summary: SummaryHighlightsVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackIf you can mascara, you can Falscara! KISS Falscara Bond & Seal dual sided tube primes & preps lashes and locks Wisps in place for all day wear.
details: DetailsFeaturesWith Falscara Eyelash Bond & Seal, the Bond end will prime & prep lashes and the Seal end locks wisps in place for all-day wearFalscara Wisps sold separately.Item 2558997How To UseStep 1: Brush a light coat of Bond on natural lashes. A little goes a long way!Step 2: Use the Falscara Eyelash Applicator to pluck a WISP from the tray. Pick up a Wisp from the middle-outer end for optimal control and application. One by one, gently place the Wisps underneath the base of your natural lashes, slightly away from the waterline.Step 3: Dab on a thin coat of Seal under Wisps to eliminate any sticky residue and hold Wisps in place!Pro tips: Apply wisps starting from the outer corner of lashline, working inwards (or vice versa). Be sure to place Wisps right next to each other for a seamless look. If needed, use the Falscara Eyelash Applicator or your fingers to squeeze the WISPS against your natural lashes for a more secure hold.To prolong the life of your Falscara Eyelash Applicator and Wisps, after use wipe off any Bond residue with rubbing alcohol or makeup remover. With gentle care, Wisps are reusable.Precautions: Keep out of reach of children.IngredientsBond: Acrylates/Ethylhexyl Acrylate Copolymer, Butylene Glycol, Alcohol Denat., Water, AMP-Acrylates Copolymer, Phenoxyethanol, Citric Acid, Sodium Carbonate, Sorbitol, Ceteareth-25, Ethylhexylglycerin, Urea, Disodium Phosphate, Biotin, Black.Seal: Isododecane, Water, Copernicia Cerifera (Carnauba) Wax, VP/Eicosene Copolymer, Euphorbia Cerifera (Candelilla) Wax, Ceresin, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, VP/VA Copolymer, Panthenol, Hydrogenated Polyisobutene, PEG-60 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Phenoxyethanol, Polypropylsilsesquioxane, 1,2-Hexanediol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Tocopheryl Acetate.
how_to_use: Step 1: Brush a light coat of Bond on natural lashes. A little goes a long way!Step 2: Use the Falscara Eyelash Applicator to pluck a WISP from the tray. Pick up a Wisp from the middle-outer end for optimal control and application. One by one, gently place the Wisps underneath the base of your natural lashes, slightly away from the waterline.Step 3: Dab on a thin coat of Seal under Wisps to eliminate any sticky residue and hold Wisps in place!Pro tips: Apply wisps starting from the outer corner of lashline, working inwards (or vice versa). Be sure to place Wisps right next to each other for a seamless look. If needed, use the Falscara Eyelash Applicator or your fingers to squeeze the WISPS against your natural lashes for a more secure hold.To prolong the life of your Falscara Eyelash Applicator and Wisps, after use wipe off any Bond residue with rubbing alcohol or makeup remover. With gentle care, Wisps are reusable.Precautions: Keep out of reach of children.

reviews.headline: Definitely a 10/10 product !
reviews.comments: I didn't get that tense feeling on my lashes. Lashes stayed on for a long while !

reviews.headline: Sticky mess
reviews.comments: Stays sticky after applying seal. Could see dust & other small particles sticking to my lashes after 2-3 days.

reviews.headline: Mastered this product
reviews.comments: I've been using this for years starting off with just the black invisible seal and now alternating back and forth with the clear bond. I LOVE this product despite what some other reviews say. I never use it with the kiss clusters, I make my own from strips like royal silk or buy other pre cut clusters. The trick with this product is to invest in the overnighter (a MUST) as well as micellar water for removal, specifically the one with the blue top. I see people complain about never being able to get it off but i use the micellar water and hold it with a makeup remover cloth for a min or so and I've never ever had issues getting it off. The only thing I will say is I kinda feel like the clear bond holds a couple days longer than the black bond. I also occasionally note a strong odor similar to acetone in the seal portion of the clear bond on a case by case batch basis. This is completely random but makes me think there's a slight variations with certain batches. If you don't get them wet too soon, touch them up every 3 days with the bond, seal, & overnighter, and leave them alone I find they can last a week or so.

reviews.headline: Used to work well
reviews.comments: It works better immediately after the intial applications but as the days go on, the glue doesnt work as well.

reviews.headline: 10/10 recommend
reviews.comments: I am so glad they made this in a clear version! It was less noticeable with lashes on and I found it easier to remove.

reviews.headline: I have bought this product several times
reviews.comments: This is the best product to use when applying eye lashes . They stay in place for a long time and it doesn't leave a build up or residue.

reviews.headline: Gave me irritation
reviews.comments: Because its CLEAR glue, i wasnt able to properly see any residue left over during the removal process. My eyes became itchy which eventually ended up giving me contact dermatitis.

reviews.headline: Like this product
reviews.comments: Works well and lashses stay on nicely

reviews.headline: Functions great üòä quick & easy
reviews.comments: This product is great functional & easy to use .

reviews.headline: Residue is difficult to remove.
reviews.comments: Mid but gets the job done, the black glue will stain the skin under your eyes.

reviews.headline: great !
reviews.comments: The overall bond and seal is really good when using any type of lash clusters. BUT it can be very hard to get off.. I would reccomend using the kiss lash remover. It can get messy after using it multiple times and the brush seems to stick inside. overall great product !!

reviews.headline: Irritated my eyes and very sticky!
reviews.comments:
I have used other (amazon) bond and seal glues and this is the only one that has irritated my eyes and made them very itchy. (Im not sensitive)
I wanted to rip off my lashes at night, I gave it 2 tries to see if it was really the glue and comfirmed.
Also, it does leave a residue and its super sticky like it never dries.

reviews.headline: Sucks basically
reviews.comments: Exactly what I said in the cons

reviews.headline: Only lash glue I'll use
reviews.comments: I mean it when i say this is the only glue I'll ever use! I have been using this one for about a year now and its the only glue that makes my lashes last 2 weeks even thru showers and face washes. Even in the summer when i'd go into the pool with my lashes on they'd stay on for like 3-5 days straight, like i actually swear by this product üôè

reviews.headline: Didn't stick
reviews.comments: There was barely any bond coming out but there was a lot of seal . It leaves white residue that makeup remover and adhesive remover cant remove easily . About 3 hours in to my day my lashes were falling off . Embarrassing. Wouldnt buy this again .

reviews.headline: The clear is horrible
reviews.comments: I've used the black bond without any issues. But the clear leaves a gross residue all over. And if you sleep with the lashes and they last maybe two days and you'll wake up and have a white residue all over your eyes left over from the clear glue. Never had this issue with the black glue.

reviews.headline: horrible
reviews.comments: the bond is horrible. it did not make my lashes stay at all and irritated my eyes badly. (i have been doing my own lash clusters for months, im aware of do's and dont's when it comes to application.) the brush for the bond was also very impractical. the seal is useless. it did absolutely nothing and actually felt really oily. it made the bond feel even stickier, which is ironic aince the bond didnt work in the first place. this glue is impossible to remove if you dont buy the brand's remover. my last resort to removal was an alcohol wipe, which i do not recommend.

reviews.headline: I would not buy this item again
reviews.comments: First there is hardly any bond in the bottle. The retention is horrible. Lashes were falling off the same day.

reviews.headline: Wouldn't buy Again
reviews.comments: Leave my eyelashes feeling sticky even after putting on the seal and is difficult to take off.

reviews.headline: Could be better
reviews.comments: Putting on the lashes were a breeze, well for some of them. For some reason a few were having an issue sticking even though I did the same process on all of them and getting the glue off was a while other issue. Might just use another brand now.

faceoff_positive.comments:
### **How ‚Äã‚ÄãFalscara Bond & Seal works:**

1. **Bond**: 
- This is the adhesive layer in the product, which acts as a light adhesive to fix the false lashes (lash wisps) to the natural lashes. 

- The formula is clear, easy to use, does not make the lashes stiff or heavy. 

2. **Seal**: 
- Is a "sealing" layer that helps firmly fix the false lashes and minimizes the glue from sticking or clumping. 

- It also protects the false lashes, helping to keep them clean and more durable. 

---

### **How ‚Äã‚Äãto use Falscara Bond & Seal:**

1. **Prepare lashes:**

- Make sure lashes are clean, free of excess oil or mascara.

- You can use an eyelash curler to create curl first.

2. **Step 1 - Apply Bond:**

- Use the brush tip to apply a thin layer of **Bond** to the natural lashes (like applying mascara, focusing on the base of the lashes).

- Do not use too much to avoid stickiness.

3. **Step 2 - Attach Wisps:**

- Use specialized tweezers or your hands to clamp and attach each cluster of **Falscara Lash Wisps** under the natural lashes, close to the base of the lashes.

- Do this from the outside in for a natural effect.

4. **Step 3 - Apply Seal:**

- Use the brush tip of **Seal** to gently apply to the base of the lashes to lock the lashes firmly.

- This layer also helps remove stickiness and keeps lashes clean longer.

---

### **Notes when using:**

- **Do not use on skin:** Bond glue should only be applied to lashes, not directly to eyelids or skin.

- **Let real lashes breathe:** Avoid using the product continuously for many days without removing makeup to protect real lashes.

- **Gently remove makeup:** Use a specialized makeup remover (KISS Falscara Remover or makeup remover oil) to gently remove false lashes without damaging real lashes.

---

### **Advantages of Falscara Bond & Seal:**

- Easy to use at home.

- Saves time and money compared to professional eyelash extensions.

- Gentle, does not damage real lashes if used properly.

- Creates a natural effect, not heavy on the eyes.

### **Disadvantages:**
- Not as long lasting as eyelash extensions in salons, usually only lasts 1-2 days.

- May require practice to operate accurately and attach lashes evenly.
faceoff_positive.headline: This is a great product easy to use

faceoff_negative.comments:
I bought this expecting it to be a pretty long lasting glue, I like to wear my lashes for about a week at a time. After reading some reviews, I was hoping this would last at least 2-3 days, but it didn't even last overnight. I applied these and a couple hours later they were already starting to lift. After sleeping on them, they were barely hanging on. I'm used to sleeping with lashes on so I don't sleep on my face/roll around excessively. 

I don't think most people wear their lashes like this, so it may not be a problem. If you are just wearing them for the day it's just an ok glue, nothing special imo. I definitely would not get water on them. The pro is that the lashes stay very flexible and thin since you're not globbing on a ton of glue. For the amount of glue that you apply I'd say it holds good but if you are looking for something long lasting, I'd skip this. It would be very easy to reapply on the go though, so I do like that
faceoff_negative.headline: It's just eh
